result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Bremner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

   If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Character letter filed
In regards to treatment.

Defendant James M Bremner in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Court conducts plea colloquy. Court finds defendant guilty. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. 

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Sample 
- Restitution of $920.00 to Metro Drug Unit to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.   Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.


CONDITION TIME: 7 Days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence by July 20, 2015 by 7pm.
